categories.description: Mastodon is an American progressive metal band from Atlanta, known for complex compositions and concept albums.
Mastodon is a decentralized, open-source social media platform launched in 2016 as an alternative to Twitter.
Gojira is a French progressive/death metal band named after the Japanese name for Godzilla.
Opeth is a Swedish progressive metal/rock band known for blending death metal with acoustic passages.
Since 2011's 'Heritage', Opeth abandoned metal entirely for 70s-style progressive rock. Their recent albums have zero growls or heavy riffs.
Meshuggah is a Swedish extreme metal band known for polyrhythmic compositions. The name is Yiddish for 'crazy'.
Amon Amarth is a Swedish melodic death metal band known for Viking-themed music and mythology.
The band name 'Amon Amarth' is the Sindarin (Elvish) name for Mount Doom in Tolkien's Middle-earth.
Gorgoroth is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 1992, known for controversial imagery and extreme sound.
Gorgoroth is the plateau of fear and death in Mordor where Mount Doom stands in Tolkien's Lord of the Rings.
Burzum was a Norwegian black metal project created by Varg Vikernes, influential in the second wave of black metal.
Burzum is Black Speech for 'darkness' from the Ring inscription in Tolkien's Lord of the Rings.
Venom is a pioneering English black metal band formed in 1979, known for influencing the entire extreme metal genre.
Venom is Spider-Man's alien symbiote nemesis who became an anti-hero with his own movie franchise starring Tom Hardy.
Behemoth is a Polish death metal band known for blackened death metal sound and occult themes.
Behemoth is a biblical monster and a creature type in Dungeons & Dragons, representing massive beasts.
Nile is an American death metal band known for Egyptian and ancient Near Eastern themes in their music.
Carcass is an English extreme metal band and pioneers of grindcore and melodic death metal.
Sepultura is a Brazilian metal band formed in 1984. The name is Portuguese for 'grave'.
Testament is an American thrash metal band from the San Francisco Bay Area, part of the thrash metal movement.
Exodus is an American thrash metal band and one of the originators of Bay Area thrash metal.
Overkill is an American thrash metal band from New Jersey, active since 1980 with consistent output.
Death was an American band led by Chuck Schuldiner, widely regarded as pioneers of the death metal genre.
Emperor was a Norwegian black metal band known for symphonic elements and complex compositions.
Emperor Palpatine is THE Emperor of Star Wars - the Sith mastermind who orchestrated the fall of the Republic.
Immortal is a Norwegian black metal band known for their 'Blashyrkh' mythology and corpse paint.
Mayhem is a Norwegian black metal band influential in the second wave of black metal, known for controversial history.
Nightwish is a Finnish symphonic metal band known for operatic vocals and orchestral arrangements.
Epica is a Dutch symphonic metal band featuring operatic female vocals and orchestral elements.
Kamelot is an American power metal band named after the legendary castle of King Arthur, known for theatrical concepts.
Sabaton is a Swedish power metal band focused on historical wars and battles. Named after armored boots worn by medieval knights.
Eluveitie is a Swiss folk metal band that combines traditional Celtic instruments with modern metal.
The name comes from 300 BC Etruscan graffiti meaning 'The Helvetian' - they even sing in reconstructed Gaulish language!
Ensiferum is a Finnish folk metal band. The name is Latin for 'sword-bearer'.
Rammstein is a German industrial metal band known for German lyrics and spectacular pyrotechnic live shows.
Despite the industrial metal label, Rammstein's catchy hooks and mainstream success blur them into hard rock territory for many listeners.
Trivium is an American heavy metal band. Named after the classical education trivium (grammar, logic, rhetoric).
Baroness is an American heavy metal band known for progressive elements and distinctive colorful artwork.
Later Baroness albums like 'Purple' and 'Gold & Grey' shifted toward melodic progressive rock, moving away from their sludge metal roots.
Sleep is an American stoner/doom metal band known for extremely long songs and heavy, hypnotic riffs.
Ghost is a Swedish rock/metal band known for Satanic imagery combined with melodic pop-rock hooks.
Despite the corpse paint and Satanic themes, Ghost's actual music is melodic rock with heavy pop influences. The metal aesthetic misleads many.
Slayer was an American thrash metal band, one of the 'Big Four' of thrash metal alongside Metallica, Megadeth, and Anthrax.
Anthrax is one of the Big Four thrash metal bands from New York, known for combining metal with rap and hardcore.
Anthrax is a Marvel supervillain who fights the Avengers. The band definitely has better stage presence.
Kreator is a German thrash metal band, one of the 'Big Teutonic Four' of German thrash.
Darkthrone is a Norwegian black metal band influential in the second wave of black metal movement.
Dimmu Borgir is a Norwegian symphonic black metal band named after an Icelandic lava formation meaning 'dark castles'.
Arch Enemy is a Swedish melodic death metal band known for technical guitar work and powerful female vocals.
Amorphis is a Finnish metal band blending progressive, folk, and death metal elements with themes from Finnish mythology.
Insomnium is a Finnish melodic death metal band known for melancholic atmospheres and poetic lyrics.
Marduk is a legendary Swedish black metal band formed in 1990, known for extreme speed and anti-religious themes.
Marduk is the chief Babylonian deity who slew Tiamat, and appears as a deity in D&D's Babylonian pantheon.
TesseracT is a British progressive metal band known for pioneering the 'djent' sound with polyrhythmic complexity.
Tesseract is Google's open-source OCR (Optical Character Recognition) library for reading text from images.
A tesseract is a 4-dimensional hypercube in mathematics and geometry, also known as an 8-cell.
Xentrix is a British thrash metal band formed in 1985, part of the UK thrash metal movement.
Sounds like a tech startup or software framework, but it's not - just the band.
Genesis is the legendary British progressive rock band featuring Phil Collins, known for evolving from prog to pop-rock.
Genesis is the Sega Mega Drive gaming console released in 1988, known for Sonic the Hedgehog.
Genesis is Hyundai's luxury automotive brand with models like the G70, G80, and G90.
Rush was the legendary Canadian progressive rock trio known for '2112', 'Tom Sawyer', and 'Limelight'.
Early Rush albums and heavy tracks like 'Working Man' influenced countless metal bands. Neil Peart's drumming is revered across metal.
Boston is the American rock band behind the mega-hit 'More Than a Feeling' and 'Peace of Mind'.
Kansas is the American progressive rock band known for 'Carry On Wayward Son' and 'Dust in the Wind'.
Chicago is the American rock band famous for their horn section, known for '25 or 6 to 4' and 'If You Leave Me Now'.
Tesla is the American hard rock band formed in 1984, known for 'Love Song' and 'Signs'.
Tesla is Elon Musk's electric vehicle company, revolutionizing the automotive industry.
Tesla embodies Silicon Valley disruption culture with Elon Musk's vision of sustainable energy.
Tesla makes the Model S, Model 3, Model X, Model Y, Cybertruck, and Roadster electric vehicles.
Journey is the American rock band known for 'Don't Stop Believin', 'Separate Ways', and 'Faithfully'.
Queen is the legendary British rock band fronted by Freddie Mercury, known for 'Bohemian Rhapsody' and 'We Will Rock You'.
Eclipse is a Swedish hard rock band known for melodic hooks and anthemic choruses.
Eclipse is the famous Java IDE (Integrated Development Environment) widely used for software development.
The Mitsubishi Eclipse was a sports car produced from 1989 to 2012, and later revived as the Eclipse Cross SUV.
An eclipse is an astronomical event where one celestial body moves into the shadow of another (solar or lunar eclipse).
Phoenix is a French indie rock band known for '1901' and 'Lisztomania', bringing French flair to alternative rock.
The phoenix is a legendary creature in D&D, a magical firebird that resurrects from its own ashes.
The phoenix is a mythical firebird from Greek mythology that cyclically regenerates from fire.
The Pontiac Phoenix was a compact car produced by General Motors from 1977 to 1984.
While the mythical phoenix is bird-like, it's not an actual bird species - just mythology and the band.
Phoenix is a constellation in the southern sky, named after the mythical firebird.
Phoenix is Jean Grey's cosmic alter-ego in X-Men, the most powerful entity when she wields the Phoenix Force.
Phoenix was NASA's Mars lander mission in 2008 that confirmed water ice on Mars.
Phoenix is a major creature type in Magic: The Gathering, known for returning from the graveyard.
Nirvana was Kurt Cobain's grunge band that defined the early 90s with 'Smells Like Teen Spirit' and 'Come As You Are'.
Toto is the American rock band behind the mega-hits 'Africa', 'Rosanna', and 'Hold the Line'.
Saga is the Canadian progressive rock band known for 'On the Loose' and 'Wind Him Up'.
Foreigner is the British-American rock band known for 'I Want to Know What Love Is', 'Cold as Ice', and 'Juke Box Hero'.
Cream was the British rock supergroup with Eric Clapton, Jack Bruce, and Ginger Baker, pioneering power trio format.
Traffic was the British rock band featuring Steve Winwood, known for blending rock, jazz, and psychedelia.
Traffic is a web analytics term referring to the number of visitors and interactions on a website.
Styx is the American rock band behind 'Mr. Roboto', 'Come Sail Away', and 'Renegade'.
Styx is the Greek underworld river that souls must cross, with Charon as the ferryman.
The River Styx appears in D&D as one of the rivers of the Lower Planes, particularly in the Nine Hells.
Asia is the British progressive rock supergroup known for 'Heat of the Moment' and 'Only Time Will Tell'.
Europe is the Swedish rock band known for the anthems 'The Final Countdown' and 'Carrie'.
While 'The Final Countdown' is pure arena rock, Europe's earlier and recent albums lean into heavy/power metal territory with heavier guitars.
Scorpions is the German rock band known for 'Wind of Change' and 'Rock You Like a Hurricane'.
Early Scorpions albums like 'Blackout' and 'Love at First Sting' are considered heavy metal. They softened into arena rock by the late 80s.
Rainbow was Ritchie Blackmore's rock band formed after leaving Deep Purple, known for 'Man on the Silver Mountain' and 'Since You Been Gone'.
With Ronnie James Dio on vocals, early Rainbow albums like 'Rising' are considered foundational heavy metal. Later albums went more commercial rock.
Viper is a Brazilian heavy metal band formed in 1985, part of the Brazilian metal scene.
Vipers are poisonous snake monsters in Dungeons & Dragons, including giant vipers and other serpent creatures.
The Dodge Viper is an American sports car known for its powerful V10 engine, produced from 1992 to 2017.
